attributes.action: Put table tennis tables in all parks and recreation fields.
attributes.additional_details:
In Greater London there is a lack in table tennis tables in parks and playgrounds. I don’t live near one that is within a 30 minute walk and that is often occupied like almost all others I know.
I want table tennis to be free and close to everyone as it is a fun and healthy sport.
attributes.background: At the moment in London and Greater London it is hard to find table tennis tables close to you. I want the government to make table tennis tables more readily available In public parks and playgrounds.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about recreational facilities are a matter for individual local authorities and other sports facilities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
